items.title: Bosz rekende op vertrek Veerman, nu staat hij (in het donker) op PSV-veld
items.summary: PSV is begonnen aan het kalenderjaar 2026. Hoe precies? Met Joey Veerman (geen transfer) en Ibi Afellay (nieuwe assistent) binnen de gelederen. Maar ook: met uren vertraging op het vliegveld van Eindhoven en een pikdonker en dus onbespeelbaar veld in Marbella later op de vrijdagavond.

items.title: Will Steelers vs Ravens be Rodgers' final game in the NFL?
items.summary: Aaron Rodgers has often alluded to being on the 'back nine' of his NFL career in recent years. There is a sense he could be strolling up the fairway to putt at the 18th this weekend.

items.title: De Feyenoorder die hardop over een carri√®re als darter droomde
items.summary: Voetbal International zit al ruim zes decennia boven op het voetbal. Elke dag van het weekeinde publiceren we een onvergetelijk verhaal uit ons archief. Ditmaal reizen we met de VI-Tijdmachine naar eind 2015. Speciaal voor de finale van het World Darts Championship in het Londense Alexandra Palace: Feyenoord-middenvelder Lex Immers die zijn eigen dartstoernooi bestiert, het The Hague Championship. En daar blijft het niet bij. ‚ÄòNet zo‚Äôn goede darter worden als mijn idool Raymond van Barneveld, dat is mijn droom.‚Äô

items.summary: Five years ago, Tyrhys Dolan was playing for Clitheroe - now he is preparing to face Barcelona in the Catalan derby.

items.title: I‚Äôm the ‚Äòmiracle‚Äô woken from a coma by Kenny Dalglish after Hillsborough. And now I‚Äôve met him again
items.summary: It‚Äôs said that you should never meet your heroes, but 36 years after the Liverpool manager sat by my hospital bed, I got to thank our greatest ally Born to a son of Anfield in a Warwickshire village, I grew up geographically remote from my spiritual football home. Emotionally, though, the pull of the boys in red was ever-present: from my first game at Anfield in 1974 to FA Cup final defeat at Wembley in ‚Äô77, to witnessing the first of Liverpool‚Äôs six European Cups, in Rome, when my first hero, Kevin Keegan, ran Berti Vogts ragged. I cried when Keegan left, but soon a new king was born in my imagination: Kenny Dalglish, that wily, tough, insanely skilful Scot. I travelled the country to follow my team through the peaks and troughs that culminated in the lowest possible low, on 15 April 1989, the day of the FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Nottingham Forest. There are many things I remember about Hillsborough, some of which returned to me years, even decades, later. My dad saying: ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs a nice day tomorrow, we‚Äôll go.‚Äù Ian St John on the end of my hospital bed. My best mate laughing as I struggled to eat a yoghurt. The endless bright white lights of the Royal Hallamshire. The surreal trip to my local hospital in an ancient, drafty ambulance. One thing I don‚Äôt remember, though, is meeting my hero. And for good reason. For I‚Äôm the ‚Äúmiracle‚Äù boy woken by the sound of Kenny‚Äôs voice when he spoke at my bedside. Continue reading...

items.title: Thomas Frank admits ‚Äòit‚Äôs difficult to enjoy‚Äô being Tottenham head coach
items.summary: Frank likens challenges at Spurs to running a marathon Tottenham booed off after goalless draw at Brentford Thomas Frank has admitted he is not enjoying his job at Tottenham. The head coach is dealing with numerous problems as he navigates what always stood to be a transitional season, the most insistent being his team‚Äôs lack of creativity. Spurs were booed off after Thursday‚Äôs 0-0 draw at Brentford by the travelling support, who also chanted ‚Äúboring, boring Tottenham‚Äù. But Frank is confident he will come to look back on the first half of his debut campaign more fondly once ‚Äì and not if ‚Äì his squad emerges on the other side, stronger and wiser for the suffering. Tottenham are 12th in the Premier League ‚Äì their next game is at home to Sunderland on Sunday and Frank leant into a marathon-running analogy when he was asked whether he was enjoying the challenge to which he has signed up. Continue reading...

items.title: Another year, another manager ‚Äì but it is unfair to paint Chelsea‚Äôs project as a flop | Jacob Steinberg
items.summary: Enzo Maresca got the sack because of his actions. That does not mean the club‚Äôs structure needs a complete overhaul Some clubs build around their manager. Eddie Howe is hugely influential at Newcastle and Aston Villa are pretty much Unai Emery FC these days. Chelsea, though, have adopted an alternative model. They have a team of five sporting directors, led by Paul Winstanley and Laurence Stewart, and do not want one person to hold all the power. Yet the question many are asking in the wake of Enzo Maresca‚Äôs demise is whether the template will yield success at the very highest level. It is never quiet at Chelsea. They are often busy in the transfer market, meaning there is an element of players coming and going, and they are now looking for their fifth permanent head coach since a consortium led by Todd Boehly and Clearlake Capital, a private equity firm run by Behdad Eghbali and Jos√© E Feliciano, bought the club from Roman Abramovich in 2022. Continue reading...
